subject: Sales
title: Why Buyers Choose Brands Over Products
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Buyers Choose Brands Over Products.

hook.text: Two identical products sit side by side. One has a logo you know. You grab it without thinking.

buildup.text: Brand familiarity creates a shortcut. Known brands reduce the mental effort required to decide.

discovery.text: Neuroscience shows branded products activate reward centers. Unbranded ones trigger analytical thinking.

twist.text: Buyers often choose inferior products from superior brands. Perception routinely trumps reality.

climax.text: Build a brand strong enough that your name alone reduces hesitation. That's the ultimate sales advantage.

punchline.text: A strong brand sells before the pitch begins.

quiz.question: Why do branded products activate reward centers in the brain?
options: Familiarity creates a cognitive shortcut that feels rewarding
